60.heading: McCay, Winsor, 1867-1934--Articles About.
60.title: Caldecott & Co. : notes on books and pictures
60.author: Maurice Sendak.
notes: Bibliography: p. 215-216.

Chapter headings include: Mother Goose, Randolph Caldecott, Hans Christian Andersen, Lothar Meggendorfer, Beatrix Potter, Winsor McCay, Jean de Brunhoff, and Walt Disney; includes autobiographical essays. 1. Children's literature

History and criticism. 2. Caldecott Medal books. 3. McCay, Winsor. 4. Brunhoff, Jean de, 1899-1937. 5. Disney, Walt, 1901-1966. 6. Potter, Beatrix, 1866-1943. 7. Mother Goose. 8. Meggendorfer, Lothar. 9. Andersen, H. C. (Hans Christian), 1805-1875. 10. Sendak, Maurice. I. Sendak, Maurice. II. Farrar, Straus, and Giroux. Call no.: PS3569.E6A16 1988

notes: Compares Calvin and Hobbes with Little Nemo, reviewing the book by John Canemaker: Winsor McCay, His Life and Art, and the book by Bill Watterson: Something Under the Bed is Drooling.

62.heading: McCay, Winsor, 1867-1934--Articles About.
62.title: "The Image in Motion"
62.author: by Tappan W
62.appears_in: King. p. 11-18 in Crimmer's: The Harvard Journal of Pictorial Fiction (Winter 1975)
notes: SUMMARY: "The author traces the 20th century's fascination with movement, starting from Muybridge's photographic dissection of a man running and evolving through various artistic schools and media, cubism in painting, Hogarth in narrative art, Griffith in film. Comics especially are examined for their evolution from the key figure of Winsor McCay."

Kahles' "Hairbreadth Harry," Frederic Opper, Louis Forton's "La Bande des Pieds-Nickelés," Rodolphe Töpffer, Gene Colan's "Dr. Strange," and Marvel's "Captain Marvel."

133.heading: McCay, Winsor, 1867-1934--Miscellanea.
133.title: "Mixing with the Best of Them"
133.author: by Gunboat Hudson
notes: SUMMARY: An office-boy describes working for Harry Hershfield, Hal Coffman, C.D. Batchelor, Hoban, Tad, Arnot, Cliff Sterrett, Tom McNamara, George Herriman, Winsor McCay, Ed Wheelan, and Wex Jones.
Reprinted from Cartoons, May 1918.

134.heading: McCay, Winsor, 1867-1934--Miscellanea.
134.title: "Movie-Cartooning Secrets"
134.author: by Freeman H
134.appears_in: Hubbard. p. 385, 415-416 in The St. Nicholas Magazine, v. 61, no. 5 (Mar. 1929).
notes: Article about Winsor McCay, Pat Sullivan, Walter Lantz, and the process of animation.

135.heading: McCay, Winsor, 1867-1934--Miscellanea.
135.title: "Newspaper Comic Artists Remembered"
135.author: Hank Ketcham
notes: Shows Ketcham's painted portraits, with his commentary, of Frank King, George Herriman, Cliff Sterrett, H.T. Webster, Winsor McCay, Harold Gray, Alex Raymond, Chic Young, Billy DeBeck, Max Fleischer, Dr. Seuss, and George McManus. Cover of issue shows his painting of Percy Crosby.

136.heading: McCay, Winsor, 1867-1934--Miscellanea.
136.title: "The Real McCay"
136.author: Mike Barrier
136.appears_in: p. 43-44 in The Comics Journal, no. 120 (Mar. 1988)
notes: About animated films; reviews of McCay & Disney items.

137.heading: McCay, Winsor, 1867-1934--Miscellanea.
137.title: "Seven Keys to Circulation" p. 14 in Circulation, v. 1, no. 3
137.author: [No author]
notes: Captioned photographs of cartoonists Harry Hershfield, Russ Westover, Hal Coffman, Winsor McCay, Joseph W. McGurk, Tom McNamara, and Jean Knott.

138.heading: McCay, Winsor, 1867-1934--Miscellanea.
138.title: "Winsor McCay"
138.author: John L
138.appears_in: Fell. p. 248-252 in Film and the Narrative Tradition (Norman : University of Oklahoma Press, 1974)
notes: Sketch of McCay's life and work, including a bibliography on McCay.

139.heading: McCay, Winsor, 1867-1934--Miscellanea.
139.title: Winsor McCay : clipping file.
139.author: [No author]
notes: 1 portfolio : ill. ; 25 x 38 cm.
Collected at Michigan State University in the Russel B. Nye Popular Culture Collection's Popular Culture Vertical File (PCVF).

140.heading: McCay--Reviews.
140.title: "Between the Acts"
140.author: Pierre Fresnault-Deruelle
140.appears_in: p. 119 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 10 (Apr. 2004).
notes: (Comptes Rendus)
Review of McCay 3: Le Gardien de l'Aube (Thierry Smolderen & Jean-Philippe Bramanti).

141.title: "McCay's McChanical Muse : Engineering Comic-Strip Dreams"
141.author: Tim Blackmore
141.appears_in: p. 15-38 in Journal of Popular Culture, v. 32, no. 1 (Summer 1998).
notes: Includes illustrations and bibliographical references.

142.heading: "McCay's Monkey Trial Cartoons" p. 40-41 in Hogan's Alley, v.
142.title: 1, no. 2
142.author: [No author]
notes: (Stripper's Guide)
Describes and shows editorial cartoons about evolution produced around the 1925 trial by Winsor McCay.

143.title: McCay, Winsor, 1867-1934
notes:
American comics artist and animator, creator of Gertie the Dinosaur and Little Nemo in Slumberland. See also his
  • Dreams of the Rarebit Fiend
  • In the Land of Wonderful Dreams
  • Tales of the Jungle Imps
